Intended Results: Greater public consultation and involvement in matters regarding the environment, in line with the Aarhus Convention which the Irish Government ratified on 20th June, 2012.
Lobbying Activities: Fionntán Ó Súilleabháin requested we write a newspaper article for him to submit tot the Gorey Guardian, regarding the many thousands of trees that were forced to be destroyed.|Submission|1

Specific Details: Courtown Community Council set up a Community Meeting with 6 with Gorey-Kilmuckridge Municipal District elected councillors present. The meeting was the first in person opportunity for community to interact with the councillors in a grup etting and address some of the community concerns raised over the past two years. Especially relating to the protection of COurtown Woods, the direlect Bayveiw Hotel Site in COurtown, the mismanagement of Jet-skis in the Harbour and a few other topics.
DPOs Lobbied: Mary Farrell|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Fionntán Ó Súilleabháin|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Joe Sullivan|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Diarmuid Devereux|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Andrew Bolger|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Donal Kenny|Councillor|Wexford County Council
Subject Matter: Courtown Community Council set up a Community Meeting with 6 with Gorey-Kilmuckridge Municipal District elected councillors present. The meeting was the first in person opportunity for community to interact with the councillors in a grup etting and address some of the community concerns raised over the past two years. Especially relating to the protection of COurtown Woods, the direlect Bayveiw Hotel Site in COurtown, the mismanagement of Jet-skis in the Harbour and a few other topics.
Intended Results: The intended result was to engage with the councillors and request that they represent the community's desires to the Wexford County Council. We also wanted to create beneficial communication lines between the community groups and councillors.
Lobbying Activities: 1 Community Meeting with a dozen community group representatives present and 6 GKMD elected councillors.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Linda Sinnott, Chairperson, Courtown Community Council

Specific Details: Emails and in person meetings regarding general topics relating to socio-economic and environmental investment, development, collaboration and management in the Courtown/Riverchapel area.

Subject Matter: Emails and in person meetings regarding general topics relating to socio-economic and environmental investment, development, collaboration and management in the Courtown/Riverchapel area.
Intended Results: To improve and sustain communication with Wexford County Council, Courtown Community Council (CCC) and the local community. Lobbying on topics relating to investmat and management of community spaces, public funds for works on derelict Bayview Hotel Site, the Smart Village Strategic Plan that CCC are facilitating to gather community input on local topics, community engagement in potential land swap and development of a new Bayview Hotel.
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Linda Sinnott, Chairperson, Courtown Community Council
